intro: Carlina guittonneaui, commonly known as the mountain carline thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant features a robust, upright stem with rough, hairy leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in a dense, spherical cluster, and bloom during the summer months. Carlina guittonneaui is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
